Why actor-model boundaries help you build resilient UI flows and reduce state drift.

Actor-model thinking turns UI state into explicit, testable boundaries. When each feature is treated as an actor with a clear inbox and lifecycle, complex flows become easier to reason about and extend.

In this post, we will walk through how actor boundaries reduce hidden coupling, why message-passing scales, and what this means for modern frontend systems.

A practical introduction to statecharts for teams shipping real products.

Statecharts give teams a shared language for behavior. The goal is not diagram perfection. The goal is shipping a UI that behaves the same way every time.

This post outlines how to introduce statecharts with minimal friction, plus the few patterns that pay off the fastest.

A framework for making architecture decisions without bottlenecks.
